item.title: Nigeria's Supreme Court Showdown: Atiku and Obi Challenge Tinubu's Victory
item.description:
Nigeria's political landscape is gripped by a high-stakes legal battle as Atiku Abubakar and Peter Obi appeal the Presidential Election Petitions Tribunal's affirmation of President Bola Tinubu's victory. The Supreme Court now holds the nation's attention, poised to deliver a final verdict that will shape the country's immediate future.
Hosts: Host: Aisha (Anchor), Co-Host: James (Analyst)

item.title: Nigeria's New Tax Regime: Promise of Reform or Path to Predation?
item.description:
Today on Sunrise Daily Brief, we delve into Nigeria's impending Tax Administration Act 2025. Set for January 1 implementation, the new regime aims for fairness, but businesses fear increased harassment and extortion. We ask if this is truly a step towards reform or another burden on the Nigerian populace.
Hosts: Host: Abigail (Host), Co-Host: Titus (Activist)

item.title: Nigeria's Inflation Tumble: Real Relief or Smoke and Mirrors?
item.description:
Daily Business Watch deep-dives into Nigeria's 8th consecutive inflation drop to 14.45%, the lowest in five years, beating President Tinubu's target. Hosts Emeka and Kingsley dissect whether this offers genuine relief for struggling households and businesses, or if underlying economic pressures still loom large. The show features live listener comments and direct audience engagement on this critical economic development.

item.title: Nollywood Scandal: Suicidal Thoughts, Broken Promises, and a Pastor!
item.description:
Nollywood actress Doris Ogala alleges suicidal thoughts following a bitter dispute with Pastor Chris Okafor, who she claims reneged on a marriage promise, proposed to another woman, and orchestrated her arrest multiple times. "Entertainment Rush" dissects the shocking details.

item.title: MTN's 5G 'Unlimited' Data: Game-Changer or Gimmick? The Political Pulse Investigates
item.description:
This radio script for 'The Political Pulse' discusses MTN Nigeria's launch of unlimited 5G broadband plans. The Host, Tola, with a skeptical, sassy, Americanized Nigerian accent and a focus on social media, introduces the topic and challenges the Co-Host, Funmi, a warm and polite analyst, on the feasibility and true impact of the offering. The debate covers skepticism around 'unlimited' data, infrastructure, pricing, digital inclusion, and competition. A 'Real Talk' segment delves into the potential pitfalls and transformative benefits. The show concludes with a strong call for listener engagement and a professional outro, maintaining a high-energy, intellectual tone throughout.

item.title: Supreme Court's Bombshell: Presidential Pardon Overturned, Death Sentence Reinstated
item.description:
The episode of 'The Political Pulse' dissects the Nigerian Supreme Court's decision to overturn Maryam Sanda's presidential pardon and reinstate her death sentence for the murder of her husband. Host Aisha and Co-Host James engage in a high-energy debate, exploring the constitutional implications, the separation of powers, and the impact on presidential prerogative and judicial independence. The discussion highlights the Court's emphasis on due process, ruling that a pardon cannot be granted while an appeal is pending. The show includes a 'Real Talk' segment on what this means for the average Nigerian and concludes with a call for listener engagement.
Hosts: Host: Aisha (Anchor), Co-Host: James (Analyst), Guest: Tola (Slay Queen)
Category: Law & Government

item.title: Nigeria's Digital Battlefield: Surging Cyberattacks and Bandits' High-Tech Threat
item.description:
Nigeria faces deepening digital vulnerabilities with a 1,047% surge in cyberattacks, leading to N1.1 trillion in losses since 2017. Bandits are employing sophisticated communication technologies, including bouncing calls across multiple telecom towers, making it nearly impossible for security agencies to track their activities. Experts warn that urgent and significant investment in cybersecurity infrastructure and strategy is needed to address this existential threat to national security.
Hosts: Host: Abigail, Co-Host: James, Guest: Ethan

item.title: OkeyMeta AI: The "Built From Scratch" Myth Debunked!
item.description:
This high-energy radio segment, featuring host Puck, discusses the correction issued by Techpoint Africa regarding the OkeyMeta AI. Initially reported as an LLM built from scratch, it was clarified that while Okechukwu Nwaozor developed a functional AI system, it is a hybrid model based on open-source frameworks like Google's Gemma-2B, rather than a ground-up LLM which would require immense resources. The segment emphasizes the importance of accurate reporting while still celebrating Nwaozor's significant innovative achievement.
Hosts: Host: Oliver Adekunle
Category: Technology

item.content:encoded:
This high-energy radio segment, featuring host Puck, discusses the correction issued by Techpoint Africa regarding the OkeyMeta AI. Initially reported as an LLM built from scratch, it was clarified that while Okechukwu Nwaozor developed a functional AI system, it is a hybrid model based on open-source frameworks like Google's Gemma-2B, rather than a ground-up LLM which would require immense resources. The segment emphasizes the importance of accurate reporting while still celebrating Nwaozor's significant innovative achievement.

?? Hosts: Host: Oliver Adekunle

item.title: Rivers State Erupts: Fubara Accused of Lying, Defects to APC Amidst Wike Feud!
item.description:
The political crisis in Rivers State has escalated dramatically with Governor Siminalayi Fubara facing accusations from the State House of Assembly for allegedly making false claims regarding meetings with lawmakers. Simultaneously, reports confirm Governor Fubara's defection from the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) to the All Progressives Congress (APC). This move has fundamentally shifted the power dynamics within the state and reignited his feud with predecessor Nyesom Wike. Governor Fubara justified his defection as a "gesture of reciprocity" for President Bola Tinubu's critical support, without which he stated he would have been a "former governor."
Hosts: Host: James
Category: Politics

item.title: Nigeria's AI Boom: Innovation Meets Data Protection
item.description:
This Sunrise Daily Brief episode, hosted by Abigail, dives into Nigeria's rapid adoption of Artificial Intelligence by businesses, with 93% already integrating AI. It highlights the simultaneous rise in data protection measures, with 84% tightening privacy controls and 94% appointing privacy officers, largely driven by the Nigeria Data Protection Act (NDPA). However, the episode also addresses significant challenges such as a lack of technical skills and persistent privacy and security risks, prompting listeners to consider the balance between innovation and data safety.

item.title: Niger School Abduction: A Partial Victory or Systemic Failure?
item.description:
This episode of The Political Pulse delves into the recent release of 100 abducted schoolchildren in Niger State, examining President Tinubu's commendation of security agencies. While acknowledging the relief, the discussion critically questions the broader implications of such abductions, the remaining 150 captives, and the effectiveness of current government strategies against insecurity.

item.title: Courtroom or Clickbait? Akpabio, Natasha, and the Crisis of Public Discourse
item.description:
This episode of Samony Podcast dissects the defamation suit between Senate President Akpabio and Senator Natasha Akpoti-Uduaghan, examining Akpabio's demand for evidence in court, not social media. item.title: Cyber-Chaos: Nigeria's Digital Battleground and the Call for Regulation
item.description:
Africa is facing an alarming surge in cybercrime, with Nigeria at the epicenter, experiencing thousands of attacks weekly, heavily exploiting AI. This episode of Samony Podcast, with Mama T and Sodiq, dives deep into the crisis, the devastating impact of digital fraud, and the urgent calls for social media regulation, including Senator Ned Nwoko's proposed bill for platforms to establish physical offices in Nigeria to curb misinformation and aid security. We ask: where is the vision, the proactive strategy, the revolutionary thinking needed to protect our digital future?
Hosts: Host: Mama T (Gossip), Co-Host: Sodiq (Street)
Category: Technology

item.title: The Digital Assault: Africa's Cybercrime Crisis and the Foreign Hand

item.title: US Visa Restrictions: A Stiff Warning to Nigeria on Religious Freedom

item.title: EFCC Chair Faces Contempt: The Battle Over 27 Withheld Properties
item.description:
The chairman of Nigeria's Economic and Financial Crimes Commission (EFCC), Ola Olukoyede, is facing contempt charges from a Federal High Court in Abuja for allegedly failing to release 27 properties. These properties were previously seized under an interim forfeiture order, which the court later vacated, ruling that the EFCC failed to prove they were proceeds of crime. This episode delves into the legal ramifications and the implications for the anti-graft agency's credibility.
Hosts: Host: Oga Titus (Boss), Co-Host: Aisha (Radio)
Category: Law & Government

item.title: Nigeria's $363 Million Beans Ban: A Deep Dive into Agricultural Loss
item.description:
This episode of the Samony Podcast unpacks Nigeria's annual $363 million loss from the EU ban on dried beans exports. We discuss the reasons behind the protracted ban, primarily hazardous pesticide residues, and explore its significant economic impact on the nation's agricultural sector and farmers. The hosts offer their perspectives on the need for improved quality control and sustainable practices to reclaim Nigeria's position in the international market.
Hosts: Host: Peter Johnson, Co-Host: Sister Nkechi
Category: Business & Finance

item.title: Nigeria's 2030 Vision: Can We Truly Be HIV-Free?
item.description:
On World AIDS Day 2025, Nigeria's First Lady, Senator Oluremi Tinubu, urged national support for the goal of eradicating HIV/AIDS by 2030. This episode delves into the country's significant progress, including a 46% decline in new infections, while also dissecting the persistent challenges of funding gaps and societal stigma hindering this ambitious objective.

item.title: Nigeria's Recurring Health Crisis: Resident Doctors' 29-Day Strike and the Fragile Truce
item.description:
This episode delves into the recent 29-day indefinite strike by the Nigerian Association of Resident Doctors (NARD), exploring its causes, the demands of the doctors, and the impact on Nigeria's already strained healthcare system. We analyze the Memorandum of Understanding signed with the Federal Government, discussing whether this suspension is a genuine resolution or another temporary pause in a long-standing cycle of industrial action and unfulfilled promises.
Hosts: Host: HypeMan (Naija), Co-Host: Tola (Slay Queen)
Category: Health

item.title: The Island Roars: Mauritius Dethrones Nigeria in Private Equity
item.description:
This episode of the Samony Podcast dives deep into the seismic shift in African private equity, where Mauritius has dramatically surpassed Nigeria in deal value in the first nine months of 2025. We explore the 'why' behind Mauritius's meteoric rise, highlighting its stable regulatory environment and strategic financial policies, while dissecting the factors contributing to Nigeria's significant decline, including economic volatility and policy inconsistencies. Join us as we uncover the implications for Africa's investment landscape.
Hosts: Host: Peter Johnson, Co-Host: HypeMan (Naija)
Category: Finance

item.title: Justice Delayed? Emefiele's Trial Hits Another Roadblock as EFCC Witnesses are Rejected
item.description:
The Samony Podcast delves into the recent FCT High Court decision to reject key EFCC witnesses in the high-profile trial of former CBN Governor, Godwin Emefiele. We explore the procedural reasons behind this significant setback for the prosecution, the implications for the ongoing case, and what it means for justice in Nigeria, with the trial now adjourned to January 2026.
Hosts: Host: Oga Titus (Boss), Co-Host: Sodiq (Street)
Category: Politics
